TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed BindableSupport extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies values to indicate whether a property can be bound to a data element or another property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is used at design time to indicate whether a designer should offer a property as available for data binding in a visual designer. This class does not affect whether the property can be data bound at runtime.
## Examples For an example on how to use the BindableSupport enumeration to indicate whether a property can be bound, see the sample code in <xref:System.ComponentModel.BindableAttribute.%23ctor%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ComponentModel.BindableSupport Default = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The property is set to the default.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ComponentModel.BindableSupport No = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The property is not bindable at design time.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ComponentModel.BindableSupport Yes = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The property is bindable at design time.
